testcase.classname: As an administrator (admin), I should be able to update the visitor purpose information registered in the
testcase.name: A PATCH request to the "/api/updateBloodGroup" endpoint with valid authorization and correct
testcase.system-out: * The api user sets "api/updateBloodGroup" path parameters..................passed * The api user prepares a PATCH request containing 520,"name update" and "1" information to send to the api updateBloodGroup endpoint..passed * The api user sends a PATCH request and saves the returned response........passed * The api user verifies that the status code is 200.........................passed * The api user verifies that the "message" information in the response body is "Success"..passed * The api user verifies that the updateid information in the Response body is the same as the id information in the patch request body.passed

testcase.classname: As an administrator (admin) I should be able to access the Visitor Purpose List via API connection.
testcase.name: Invalid Token When a GET request is sent to the /api/visitorsPurposeList endpoint with invalid authorization
testcase.system-out: * The api user sets "api/visitorsPurposeList" path parameters...............passed * The api user sends a GET request, saves the returned response, and verifies that the status code is '403' with the reason phrase Forbidden..passed
